title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live on Monday 21 August 2017 - BBC News

football fan charged over homophobic abuse .
convict back in jail after 22 years on run .
baby deer born at twycross zoo .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: regular live coverage on this page has ended for the day , but breaking news , sport and travel updates will continue to appear through the night .
east midlands live returns from 08:00 tomorrow morning .

documents.title: watch : 'weird ' toe wrestling championships take place
text: here 's a nice video to sum up this weekend 's unusual competition in ashbourne
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : wildlife in the east midlands
text: our wonderful wildlife has been caught on camera by photographers across the region .
this spider was getting in a spin in belper .
meanwhile , this cheeky little squirrel was caught stealing nuts in east leake .
and this busy bee has bee-n enjoying himself on this bee-utiful monday in birstall .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'maguire can be important leicester figure '
text: 'maguire can be important leicester figure '

documents.title: hundreds of leicester children benefit from free breakfast
text: up to 700 children in leicester have taken up the offer of a free breakfast over the summer holidays .
the scheme to help disadvantaged families was launched by verity bryan , a mum from new parks , who was concerned that children who relied on free school meals would go hungry .
the breakfast boxes were made up of donations from the public and local groups .
megan and her one-year-old son were supported by the project .
she told the bbc : `` i am on benefits and i struggle anyway .
i 've not long moved into my own house so there 's mountains and mountains of things that you 've got to pay for .
`` the help that verity gave us was incredible .
for myself , my little boy , my mum and her son , we could not have got through the holidays without it . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'technical issue ' disrupting police 's 101 number
text: this might explain why you 're struggling to get through to derbyshire police on their 101 number .
we 're sorry to say that a technical issue is causing delays with our 101 service .
we recommend our online portal :
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : cctv shows fatal stabbing
text: cctv footage has shown the moment lauric lebato was murdered in leicester .
it forms part of an emotional video put together by mr lebato 's father tagbeu following his son 's death in albion street in february .
tagbeu lebato said his life has been destroyed by his son 's death .
he describes how he left his home in the ivory coast to give his son a better future in england .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : baby deer born at twycross zoo
text: twycross zoo has announced the birth of their latest arrival - a baby michie 's tufted deer .
the species are usually found in a small area of south eastern china but they 're listed as `` near-threatened '' due to overhunting .
the little boy seems to be finding his feet
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cash machine ram raids 'could be linked '
text: two ram raids on the staffordshire/derbyshire border involving diggers may be linked to a series of cash machine raids elsewhere in the country .
earlier this month , police in the east midlands said they believed a string of such incidents on the nottinghamshire and leicestershire border showed a `` distinctive focus '' .
they said the offences almost always happened in the early hours , involved the use of a digger , a truck to take the cash machine away and then a car as the final getaway vehicle .
the two linked ones in the west midlands happened in kings bromley on 2 august followed by a robbery in nearby hatton the next day .
today , staffordshire police says it 's working with the forces in the east midlands to establish if they are all linked together or not .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east midlands weather update : a cloudy but mostly dry evening
text: it 'll be cloudy and overcast for the rest of today with the chance of a few drizzly showers in places .
tonight , it 'll be cloudy but mostly dry with a chance of some mist patches forming in places .
lows of14c ( 57f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: mp : 'i did n't bow before big clock '
text: a crowd of people gathered in parliament square earlier to witness big ben 's final chimes at 12:00 today .
while many were upset , others like engineer neil tomlinson , from derbyshire , took a pragmatic approach .
`` it 's got to be repaired , so they 're repairing it , '' he told the bbc , bemused at the fuss the plans have caused .
derby north mp chris williamson was also unimpressed with the fuss some of his colleagues were making
needless to say , i was n't to be found bowing before a big clock today # bigben # priorities
marvellous
if it was `` needless to say '' - why say it ?
learn your british history or , perhaps you do n't want to be british , easy solution reckon !
ridiculous the worse part of it all why has no one questioned why it will take 4 years to upgrade the tower ?
4 years ? ?
works are for safety reasons + associated h & s for actual works .
we know too well what happens if we scrimp on safety
# bigben how worrying it is that our pm & so many mp 's prioritised this over brexit chaos , impending nuclear war & party infighting !
why not ?
your constituents must be in uproar
i 'm reminded of this cinematic iconic image
you would probably prefer to bow to maduro would n't you ?
he is running such a democratic government , after all .
indeed
do you know how many of the big ben worshipping mp 's visited grenfell towers ?
i would say not many at all .
bit of an attention seeking/virtue signalling tweet .
ignore the `` bong brigade & do the important stuff .
there 's a lot more to worry about in this country than a bloody clock getting repaired .
i 'm offended by thousands of my fellow citizens having to rely on food banks .
get things in perspective .
the clock is a just bloody clock .
immigrants come here to work , they 're vital to the nhs and our economy in general .
they do the jobs homegrown idle layabouts wo n't do .
got anything you can share that backs up evidence for these claims ?
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man jailed for life for leicester murder
text: a man has been jailed for life with a minimum term of 24 years for the murder of lauric lebato in leicester .
sulaiman sillah , 20 , of bateman road in the city , was found guilty at birmingham crown court earlier today .
mr lebato , 22 , died after being stabbed at a house party in albion street in february .
another man , 20-year-old sheriff oluwa , of upperton road , was also found guilty of violent disorder and jailed for 30 months .
author: Andy Trigg
BBC Radio Leicester reporter

documents.title: chesterfield assistant boss eyre leaves
text: chesterfield assistant boss eyre leaves

documents.title: ambulance staff cars broken into
text: cars belonging to ambulance staff in retford have been broken into while they were at work treating patients , emas has said .
it happened in the car park of the north road ambulance station on saturday evening .
the items stolen were of low value - including headphones and an empty sunglasses case - but damage was caused to the vehicles .
wendy hazard , from emas , said : `` whoever did this did this would have known they belonged to our staff . ''
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: convict back in jail after 22 years on run
text: a man who absconded from hmp sudbury in derbyshire 22 years ago is back behind bars after being arrested in france .
michael john ashworth was arrested while trying to board the eurotunnel yesterday .
today , magistrates in medway , kent , told the 57-year-old , who 's been living in holland , he must serve the rest of his sentence .
he had been accused of escaping from lawful custody , but the case was withdrawn by magistrates who heard he was on temporary licence and should not have been charged with the offence .
the court heard ashworth should have been charged with being `` unlawfully at large following expiration of temporary licence '' .
ashworth said he had told police he wanted to hand himself in .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: answers sought after car park collapse
text: answers sought after car park collapse

documents.title: newark murder accused appears in court
text: a man accused of murdering a woman in newark has appeared in court .
nottinghamshire police were called to an address in mill gate on wednesday .
karen jacquet , 58 , was pronounced dead at the scene .
yousuf mohammed , 65 , of mill gate , was remanded in custody and is due back at nottingham crown court in november .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: investigation into nottingham car park collapse begins
text: ncp is starting a `` thorough internal investigation '' into the partial collapse of a car park in nottingham city centre this weekend .
a spokesman said they `` have informed the landlord , and will co-operate with any investigation conducted by the regulatory authorities '' .
the car park will remain closed until further notice , with customers advised to use the nearby st james street car park .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man found guilty of leicester murder
text: a man has been found guilty of murdering another man following a party in leicester .
lauric lebato , 22 , died in hospital after being found with a stab wound in albion street at about 04:00 bst on 11 february .
sulaiman sillah , 20 , from bateman road in leicester , has been found guilty of murder , wounding with intent and violent disorder by a jury at birmingham crown court .
his co-defendant , sheriff oluwa , was convicted of violent disorder .
both will be sentenced later this afternoon .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football fan charged over homophobic abuse
text: one of two men arrested at leicester city 's clash against brighton has been charged with chanting indecently under section 3 of the football offences act .
a 44-year-old leicester man is accused of making homophobic comments during the match at the king power stadium .
a second man , who was arrested on sus of making homophobic comments , has been given a conditional caution .
in total , leicestershire police said three people were removed from the ground for `` disorderly behaviour '' .
two were brighton fans and one was a leicester city fan .
their details are being passed on to their clubs for them to consider their attendance at future matches , the force added .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'derbys home form key to quarter-final '
text: 'derbys home form key to quarter-final '

documents.title: watch : bbc reporter in filming 'stand-off ' with horse
text: this is what happened when i tried to do some filming near this mighty beast near bennerley viaduct
author: Peter Saull
BBC Radio Nottingham Political Reporter

documents.title: east midlands weather update : possible rain this afternoon
text: it will be dull , cloudy and overcast throughout the afternoon with some light rain possible at times , particularly in northern parts of the region .
highs of 19c ( 66f )
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: eurotunnel arrest over 1995 prison escape
text: a man accused of absconding from prison 22 years ago has been arrested by kent police at the channel tunnel in france .
michael john ashworth , 57 , was held in coquelles on sunday while trying to board a eurotunnel shuttle to the uk .
he is alleged to have absconded from hmp sudbury in derbyshire in 1995 , where he was serving a five-year sentence for drug offences .
he has been charged with escaping from lawful custody and is due before medway magistrates later .
author: Sue Nicholson
BBC News

documents.title: nottingham park cordon taken down
text: another update from police about the alleged assault in nottingham 's arboretum .
the police cordon was taken down at about 11:00 .
police added a woman , who was believed to have been punched in the face , suffered minor injuries and did n't require hospital treatment .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man to stand trial for murder
text: i 'm at nottingham crown court , where the trial of rajesh khunti is due to start .
the 30-year-old denies the murder of dilovan mohammed , who was found stabbed outside leicester railway station in march .
author: Amy Harris
Reporter, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: yarn from sheep will help to keep ewe warm
text: forget style and colour - this winter you can choose your woolly jumper by sheep .
an animal sanctuary in bilsthorpe is ensuring a flock of sheep named `` the hooligans '' earn their keep by selling their wool .
you can chose a new woolly number made from a ball of edward , hilda or dumpy .
all have heartwarming tales of rescue .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: root and fletcher sign new notts deals
text: root and fletcher sign new notts deals

documents.title: woman 'punched in face ' in nottingham park
text: police have now told us a woman was believed to have been punched in the face in nottingham 's arboretum last night .
officers were called to addison street yesterday at about 16:30 .
a cordon was in place this morning at the park entrance .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man in serious condition after worksop 'assault '
text: a man remains in a serious condition in hospital after an alleged assault in worksop in the early hours of friday .
nottinghamshire police said the incident took place in bridge place at about 02:10 bst .
the 22-year-old man is in a serious but stable condition at the royal hallamshire hospital in sheffield .
a 19-year-old man was arrested and has now been released under investigation , the force added .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: county ins & outs 2017
text: county ins & outs 2017

documents.title: hacker hoped shutting down sports direct website would get him job
text: a computer hacker shut down the website of one of europe 's largest retailers in the hope of gaining employment with them .
jason polyik had hoped his actions would result in sports direct employing him , derbyshire police said .
the force added polyik , of shirebrook , targeted a second firm in the cyber attacks between july and september last year .
polyik left his contact details with both firms in the hope that they may employ him but instead , they contacted the police .

at derby crown court on thursday , the 27-year-old was given a suspended sentence after admitting three counts of causing a computer to perform a function with the intent to secure unauthorised access .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: armed police arrest man with 'offensive weapon '
text: these photos of armed police in the braunstone area of leicester were sent to the bbc over the weekend .
they were taken on aylmer road on saturday morning .
police have just confirmed a 22-year-old man was arrested on sus of being in possession of offensive weapon in a public place .
he has since been charged .
police added armed officers were deployed as a matter of `` public and officer safety '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police cordon at park after reports of assault
text: there is a police cordon at the entrance to nottingham 's arboretum this morning .
nottinghamshire police has confirmed they were called out after receiving reports of an assault .
we have asked the police for more information and will bring it to you once we have it .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: was big ben named after nottinghamshire boxer ?
text: you 'll have no doubt heard that big ben will fall silent at 12:00 today and the bongs wo n't sound regularly again until 2021 .
it 's because of a major refurbishment of the elizabeth tower and the clock .
what you might not know is it 's possible connection to a hucknall boxer .
the exact origin of the name big ben is the subject of some debate .
there are claims it 's connected to pugilist big ben caunt , from the nottinghamshire town , who later ran a pub near the palace of westminster .
ben 's great-granddaughter , linda west , said : `` he was renowned here and in america as 'big ben ' .
`` i believe that , because it was in the vernacular - a large item would be termed 'a big ben ' - i would think a bell of that size would have been called 'a big ben ' . ''
ben was about 6ft 2ins and would fight in matches that would last as many as 90 rounds .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mahrez situation 'not complicated ' for leicester boss
text: craig shakespeare has said riyad mahrez 's situation at the football club is `` not complicated '' for him .
over the summer mahrez said he wanted to leave leicester city , but he 's still at the club and has played in the first two league games this season .
shakespeare said : `` if we do n't get a bid that the club accepts he stays .
`` while he stays and is professional and focused and plays for the team as well as himself , then he 'll be considered for selection . ''
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: online crime reporting service now permanent
text: the ability to report a crime online has now become permanent feature on the nottinghamshire police website .

the force has been trialling the system for the last four months and said it 's been used more than 300 times by people reporting crimes like thefts , criminal damage , hate crimes and even historic sexual offences .
the reporting system allows a victim of crime to track the investigation through to its conclusion .
they can also register to receive updates from the officer investigating their case .

these new online services are all about making our service more accessible to the public we serve by offering a secure , easy-to-use platform as another option for victims of crime who find doing business online more comfortable and convenient , depending on their own personal circumstances and situation . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: former derby county boss gets israeli coaching job
text: former england and derby county boss steve mcclaren has joined israeli club maccabi tel aviv as a coaching consultant .

the 56-year-old , who also managed nottingham forest in 2011 , will work under manager jordi cruyff , who played at manchester united when mcclaren was sir alex ferguson 's assistant from 1999 to 2001 .
`` steve mcclaren has a wealth of knowledge and is vastly experienced at the highest levels of european football , '' said maccabi tel aviv owner mitch goldhar .
`` we are delighted to add a person of his calibre to our staff on a coaching consultant role . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: some y not festival goers still waiting for refunds
text: derbyshire 's y not festival will have to change next year , according to the man who owns the land it 's held on .
work is continuing to repair damage done in the main field , which is still described as `` 90 % mud '' nearly a month after it was held .
the festival , near matlock , was cancelled part way through due to mud safety fears .
the field is owned by farmer arnie flowers , who 's preparing to negotiate next year 's festival with the organisers .
despite saying seeing his land churned up was `` soul destroying '' , he said : `` we would have them back but there would have to be contingency plans . ''
festival goers have been offered partial refunds but some have n't received theirs .
in response , a y not spokeswoman said : `` everyone who bought a ticket and attended the festival has received a 50 % refund because of the final day cancellation .
`` we 've heard from a number of people who have n't received their refund yet and we 're getting this fixed . ''
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ibiza death man was 'sensible drinker '
text: the family of a mansfield man , who fell to his death in ibiza earlier this month , have described him as `` kind , hard-working and sensible '' .
callum marriott , 26 , died in the early hours of 6 august when he fell into the inner courtyard at the tanit hotel in san antonio .
his sister jessica said callum , who was on holiday on the spanish island , was a sensible drinker and he 'd been drinking water for two hours before leaving his friends to go to sleep in the hotel .
`` i wish we knew more about the scenario in which he fell and hope in light of this tragedy cctv is implemented at this hotel and others to help protect residents , '' she said .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: more restrictions in place for broadmarsh work
text: there are more restrictions for drivers in nottingham city centre today to allow hoardings to be put up around the now empty broadmarsh car park .
collin street , middle hill and carrington street have been reduced to one lane and canal street has been reduced to two lanes .
the old car park is being demolished in a £ 250m project .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man charged with sexual touching after tram incident
text: a man has been charged with sexual touching of a child after an incident on a nottingham tram .
police said it happened between hyson green and the city centre at about 13:55 bst on wednesday .
a 49-year-old radford man is set to appear before magistrates today .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'weird ' toe wrestling championships return
text: it 's like arm wrestling but , er , with feet
the world toe wrestling championships were held in fenny bentley , near ashbourne , over the weekend .
the contest has been held in a pub in the village since the 1970s .
our reporter liam barnes ( left ) got his socks off at the bentley brook inn for a bout .
thankfully , all competitors ' feet are checked over by a podiatrist before going toe to toe .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football fans arrested over homophobic abuse
text: for the first time ever , leicester city played brighton and hove albion at the king power stadium on saturday in the premier league .
but for some fans , the game was marred by reports of homophobic chanting by a small number of leicester city fans .
in the last 20 or so minutes the chanting started towards the brighton fans and then after that it got a bit more nasty with a few isolated shouts , which were a bit more malicious .
it made me very shaken , i felt a bit unsafe and very unwelcome in a place i 've been going to since i was eight years old .
police confirmed two leicester fans were arrested on sus of homophobic abuse .
graham smith is the chair of foxes pride and said the club is being `` proactive '' when it comes to stopping abusive lgbt language , but believes they could do more .
he has suggested the club warn fans before the match that they could be thrown out and arrested if they use homophobic language .

a leicester city spokesman said : `` while disappointed that such abuse took place during saturday 's match , we are satisfied that our stewards reacted swiftly and appropriately , which led to the responsible minority being ejected from the stadium and reported to the police . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cars still inside collapsed car park
text: this is what one of nottingham 's busiest car parks looks like this morning after part of it collapsed over the weekend .
vehicles were left dangling over the edge of the ncp car park in mount street after part of a wall came away in the early hours of saturday .
this morning , you can see the metal fencing and barriers blocking the entrance to the car park .
unbelievably , there are still cars inside on some of the lower floors .
you can see where the concrete has fallen away from the first floor level and three levels above it .
there 's still a bit of debris on the ramp up to the entrance and floor below .
ncp staff are on site guarding the entrance .
the company says structural engineers are on site working to make the car park safe in order for it to reopen , but there 's no indication of when that will be .
author: Hayley Compton
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather outlook
text: here 's how it 's looking today
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: footballers charged with gbh after nightclub incident
text: two footballers have been charged with inflicting grievous bodily harm without intent following an incident outside a leicester nightclub .
cardiff city forward lee tomlin and accrington stanley striker billy kee have been charged with inflicting grievous bodily harm without intent in relation to the incident on 22 january .
mr tomlin , 28 , and mr kee , 26 , will continue to play for their teams ahead of their appearance at leicester magistrates ' court on 18 september .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : the latest on the roads
text: travel : the latest on the roads
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning - yes , monday has come around again .
i 'll be writing your east midlands live page today along with dave wade .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can send an email or use facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
